creator: bryan.pieper@conagrafoods.com
text:
When I run the following task:

<style destdir="a directory"
basedir="a directory"
style="location/checkstyle.xsl"/>

The tasks will create a directory called "a%20directory" instead of using the 
existing "a directory".  The result of the xsl transformation ends up in the 
wrong directory.  In this case, I am creating an XML document with checkstyle 
3.3 and creating the report in the same directory as the XML file.  Because of 
the second directory being created, the transformation does not work correctly 
because the files are in two different directories.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
I've committed a unit test for this and it passes for me (Linux, JDK 1.4).

Could be a platform or processor issue.  Whic OS and whoch XSLT processor are you
using?

The unit test also passes on Windows.  Please try a nightly build of Ant to see
whether the problem has been fixed by now (maybe even 1.6.2 works already).
